result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter T. RADTKE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Payment Plan Due Date Summary
Payment Plan requested for monthly payment of $60.00; payment plan documents filed with case.
Reminder Notice - Final Notice

The Court imposes a $100.00 fine plus costs, total of $579.00.  $50.00 cash bail applied.  $529.00 balance is to be paid by 10-12-16 or 10 days county jail for failure to pay.
Minutes.

Theft - false representation - No contest plea.   Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 08-12-16 at 11:00 a.m.
